intro: Drepanostachyum polystachyum, commonly known as the golden bamboo, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense clusters of golden-yellow inflorescences. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and elegant appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its unique botanical features make it a popular choice for both landscape design and horticultural collections.
